title: Create Erigon Backup/Restore point?

body:
- If Erigon stopped - it‚Äôs ok do move/backup datadir. 
- logs show that Erigon works well (see db), but RpcDaemon not - likely it‚Äôs miss-configuration of rpcdaemon.
- show cli flags of rpcdaemon

@AskAlexSharov 100% correct, was rpcdaemon!

I had changed the config but forgot to restart supervisord!

Using the following command works perfectly fine with the directory copied from another server:

```
/opt/erigon/build/bin/rpcdaemon --datadir=/erigon/datadir --private.api.addr=localhost:9090 --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --http.port=8545 --http.vhosts=* --http.corsdomain=* --http.api=eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool --ws
```

This now enables us to create weekly backups on a local SAN thus should anything go wrong we will only ever need to re-sync the last 7 days.

If anyone wants to download this backup from a new fully synced unused archive node we could potentially provide a download url, in which case one would just need to unzip and sync the last few days?

Unzipped the fully synced erigon directory is about 1.7TB and zipped its about 704G
